alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 2:08PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Randolph County through 245 PM CDT... At 208 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodland to near Crystal Lake. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Woodland, Crystal Lake, Graham, Rock Mills, Big Springs, Paran, Roanoke Municipal Airport, Rock Stand and Napoleon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
